Material used.Material Name: Primary neuronal cultures from healthy donors
Material used.Description: The secretion of UCHL1 was measured using a luciferase reporter assay.

Readout description.Result Description: Secretion of UCHL1 decreased by 30% in the mutant.
Secretion of UCHL1 was significantly reduced in the mutant.

Biological replicates.Biological replicates: Three biological replicates were performed to assess reproducibility.

Technical replicates.Technical replicates: Each experiment was repeated three times for technical validation.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type UCHL1 expression was used as the positive control to confirm assay specificity.

Basic negative control.Description: No protein input (blank cell lysate) was used as the negative control to assess non-specific binding.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Two-way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post-hoc test was used to analyze differences between conditions.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Secretion of UCHL1 is considered normal if greater than 50% of the control value.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Secretion of UCHL1 is classified as abnormal if less than 20% of the control value.

Approved assay.Approved assay: Yes, this assay is approved for the detection of UCHL1 in human serum and plasma.
